My Route to Computer Science

Originally trained as an electrician, I went on to found an electrical contracting company before making my way into further education.

1

Trained as an electrician

After completing a 3.5 year apprenticeship in 2 years, with distinction in all exams, I went onto spend 2 years as a contract electrician where I continued to add to my technical education

2

Founded a company

Became owner and NICEIC qualified supervisor of a reputable small electrical contracting business serving domestic and commercial clients

3

Back to School

Craving a new challenge I embarked on a career change. First step was a 1 year foundation year in Interdisciplinary Science completed with distinction throughout, followed by 3 years BEng Civil and Structural Engineering at the University of Leeds where I gained a 2:1 BEng with Honours

4

Won an Award

While deciding on offers from St Andrews, Glasgow, and Bath Universities, I was awarded a Global Leaders Scholarship to study at University of Bath on the basis of academic excellence, exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, and future leadership potential.

5

MSc Computer Science

Currently a student at the University of Bath and due to graduate in September 2022. I am excited to start applying the well rounded set off skills that I have built during my 5 years of study
